content:
That's a great idea! Reaching out to Sarah is a perfect way to start rebuilding your social connections. Since you have a shared interest in hiking, it's a great conversation starter and a way to pick up where you left off.

Before you send that text, take a deep breath and remember that it's okay to reconnect with someone after a while. It's normal for friendships to ebb and flow, and Sarah might be just as excited to hear from you as you are to reach out to her.

When you send the text, try to keep it casual and friendly. You could say something like:

"Hey Sarah! It's been too long! I was thinking about our old hiking adventures and wanted to catch up. Would you be free to grab coffee or go for a hike sometime soon?"

By keeping it light and casual, you're showing Sarah that you're interested in reconnecting without putting too much pressure on the situation.

Remember to be open-minded and flexible when you talk to Sarah. You might not be able to pick up exactly where you left off, but you can start anew and see where the conversation takes you.

Go ahead and send that text! I'm rooting for you!
